result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity: initial appearance

03:15 PM Defendant Akariyah N Flemming in court in custody appearing by video with attorney Ryan W O'Hara also appearing by video.  Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $3000.00   with conditions, Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Matter continued to allow time for defendant to obtain an attorney. Adjourned initial appearance May 18, 2022 at 1pm.
